Subject: FileSystemOverview Error
Description:
Hi team

When running the FileSystemOverview report I get the error listed below:

"Arithmetic overflow error converting expression to data type int."

Researching this problem, this error in SQL occurs when an operation results in a value that exceeds the limits of the int data type. In SQL Server, for example, the int data type has a range from -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647. If a calculation or operation results in a value beyond this range, you'll encounter this error.

What can we do to fix it as I want to ensure this report is correct.

Regards
What_We_Know__c: The customer wants to run the FileSystemOverview report in NEA but was getting an error message: Arithmetic overflow error converting expression to data type int. Team on SWAT suggested running FS_Schema instant job. However, after running that job customer is getting errors in FSAA Bulk Import and FSA_Schema job too. These errors refer some DB tables that are not present.
Next_Steps__c: Dev team has asked for an escalation. However, prior to that, list of DB tables is required so that issue can be sorted out at earliest.
Solution_Comment__c: Ran the FS_Create schema job to update the schemas and customer confirmed has was able to run the file system overview job successfully.
